title: Alito Benefactor Leonard Leo Sees Funding Drop From Donor Fund
description: A top source of funding for conservative groups — including some connected to legal activist Leonard Leo — escalated giving by 27% in 2022, according to tax records.

title: House Passes Spending Plan, Easing Government Shutdown Risk
description: US House lawmakers overcame partisan animosity Tuesday to pass a temporary government funding bill that greatly lowers the risk of a shutdown even as it delays fights over Ukraine aid, border policies and deep cuts to federal programs.

title: China’s Xi Begins First US Trip in Six Years
description: President Xi Jinping arrived in San Francisco for a high-stakes meeting with his American counterpart Joe Biden on Tuesday, as the Chinese leader’s first trip to the US in six years drew crowds of protesters and supporters onto the city’s heavily policed streets.

title: US Is Quietly Sending Israel More Ammunition, Missiles
description: The Pentagon has quietly ramped up military aid to Israel, delivering on requests that include more laser-guided missiles for its Apache gunship fleet, as well as 155mm shells, night-vision devices, bunker-buster munitions and new army vehicles, according to an internal Defense Department list.

title: Biden-Xi Meeting Aimed at Reopening Dialogue Between Rivals
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Jordan Fabian previews tomorrow’s meeting between US President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Sunak’s Rwanda Showdown to Define Battle for Tory Party’s Future
description: An excoriating letter from Suella Braverman, the home secretary fired in dramatic fashion Monday, underscored the fury facing British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak among right-wing Tories hours before the Supreme Court rules on whether the government can legally deport asylum seekers to Rwanda.

title: Trump Wins Michigan Ruling to Remain on Primary Ballot
description: A judge in Michigan rejected an effort to keep Donald Trump off ballots in the state’s 2024 Republican presidential primary, but declined to rule on his inclusion for the general election.

title: AMLO Doesn’t Want to Be Seen in Acapulco to Avoid ‘Spectacle’
description: While most presidents might rush to be seen supporting victims in the aftermath of a natural disaster, Mexico’s Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador says he avoided being recorded in Acapulco after last month’s deadly Otis Hurricane because he wants to avoid “spectacle.”

title: Ken Griffin Says He’ll Decide Soon About Supporting Nikki Haley
description: Citadel founder Ken Griffin says he is close to making a decision about financially backing Nikki Haley’s presidential bid, a move that would give her campaign a boost two months out from the Iowa caucuses.

title: After $85 Billion Tab, AMLO Requests Weekly Updates From Pemex
description: Petroleos Mexicanos has been ordered to provide weekly updates on its spending to the head of the country’s tax authority, an effort by Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador to rein in excesses at the state-owned oil producer.

title: Kevin McCarthy Accused of Shoving a GOP Opponent in Capitol Dust-Up
description: Tensions among Republicans flared Tuesday following a run-in between former House Speaker Kevin McCarthy and one of the eight members of his own party who voted last month to oust him.

title: Venezuela Says EU Won’t Oversee 2024 Vote If Sanctions Persist
description: Venezuela’s head of congress said he would not invite European electoral observers next year after the European Union extended sanctions on fifty Venezuelan officials.

title: NYC Mayor Eric Adams Says He Will Cooperate With FBI Campaign Probe
description: New York Mayor Eric Adams said he would “follow the law” amid a federal investigation into his campaign financing.

title: Mexico’s AMLO to Talk Fentanyl Crisis in First Meeting With China’s Xi
description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador will meet his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping this week in their first encounter as both governments try to make progress in tackling the fentanyl crisis that’s plaguing North America.

title: UK May Switch Base Month for Benefits Rise to Save £2 Billion
description: The UK government is considering using October’s inflation number for next year’s rise in working-age benefits, two people familiar with official thinking said, a move that would hit low-income families.

title: Ex-George Santos Fundraiser Sam Miele Will Plead Guilty to US Charges
description: A former fundraiser for US Representative George Santos will plead guilty to federal criminal charges, increasing pressure on the New York congressman as he faces his own corruption charges and efforts to expel him from Congress.

title: House Intelligence Chairman Wants Michael Cohen Prosecuted for Perjury
description: Two senior congressional Republicans are seeking a federal criminal investigation into whether former Donald Trump lawyer Michael Cohen committed perjury in 2019 congressional testimony on the former president’s business dealings.

title: Fired Braverman Accuses UK’s Sunak of Betrayal, Broken Vows
description: Former UK Home Secretary Suella Braverman accused Rishi Sunak of betraying the public and breaking his promise to clamp down on immigration, in an explosive letter that threatens to exacerbate the febrile mood on the right of the governing Conservative Party.

title: House Speaker Mike Johnson Endorses Trump for President
description: US House Speaker Mike Johnson endorsed Donald Trump’s 2024 White House comeback bid in what would potentially be a rematch of the bitterly contested election waged between he and President Joe Biden four years ago.

title: DOJ Argues Casino Mogul Steve Wynn’s Foreign Lobbying Suit Should Be Reinstated
description: A US Justice Department attorney tried to persuade an appeals court that casino magnate Steve Wynn should have registered as a foreign agent when he alerted the Trump administration that China wanted to extradite a wealthy exile.

title: Biden Says US Wants Better Ties to Help China’s Economy
description: President Joe Biden said ahead of his meeting with Chinese leader Xi Jinping that the US was interested in helping China’s struggling economy — but not at the expense of American intellectual property.

title: Ukraine Recap: EBRD Nears Capital Boost to Aid Reconstruction
description: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development is closing in on a decision to approve a capital increase of €4 billion ($4.3 billion) to support Ukraine’s reconstruction, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: US Shutdown Risk Drops as More Democrats Back Speaker’s Plan
description: The odds of a Nov. 18 US government shutdown diminished Tuesday as House Speaker Mike Johnson gained more Democratic support for his interim funding plan.

title: Trump Media Reports Loss on Paltry Sales With SPAC Deadline Near
description: Donald Trump’s social-media business generated just $2.3 million in sales in the first half of the year on its way to a loss, underscoring the nascent company’s struggles as it pushes to close a deal that would make it publicly traded.

title: FDIC Chairman ‘Deeply Troubled’ by Workplace Misconduct Claims
description: The head of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. told lawmakers on Tuesday that his agency had launched an investigation into reports of misogynistic culture among bank examiners that prompted women to quit the agency.

title: Brazil’s Lula Sides With Massa in Argentina Vote as Regional Split Widens
description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva backed Argentina’s Sergio Massa ahead of Sunday’s presidential election, the latest leader taking a side in the heated contest that has highlighted Latin America’s deepening ideological divisions.

title: US-China Rivalry Worsens Despite Talks, Report to Congress Finds
description: Tensions between the US and China have worsened despite renewed diplomatic engagement in the last year and Beijing shows few signs of making major concessions, according to a report to Congress issued just a day before President Joe Biden is set to meet Chinese leader Xi Jinping in San Francisco.

title: Scholz and Meloni Seek Agreement to Tackle Migration
description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni aim to strengthen relations with a new cooperation agreement next week, as Europe’s migration crisis forges unlikely political alliances.

title: EBRD Nears $4.3 Billion Capital Increase to Support Ukraine
description: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development is closing in on a decision to approve a capital increase to support Ukraine’s reconstruction just as Kyiv’s allies are struggling to ensure longer-term aid for the country.

title: Yandex to Fully Divest Russian Assets and Distribute Proceeds
description: Yandex NV plans to sell its entire Russian business, including the nation’s most popular search engine, after its founder’s criticism of the war in Ukraine made potential investors wary of a partnership with the Dutch-domiciled parent company.

title: Finland to Tighten Russia Border Controls After Immigrant Influx
description: Finland’s government plans measures to deal with a sudden influx of migrants from third countries arriving at its border through Russia without the required documentation.

title: Texas Battles Wall Street in Threat to State’s Muni Market
description: Attorney General Ken Paxton wants to put a check on which big banks win business from the state and its municipalities.

title: US Defense Chief Won’t Meet Chinese Officials at Indonesia Military Forum
description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin won’t meet with Chinese officials during a military dialog in Indonesia because China has yet to replace its defense minister and isn’t sending anyone of the appropriate rank.

title: Israel Faces Mounting Global Pressure Over Gaza Hospital Attacks
description: Israel’s military chief spokesman was in full combat gear as he gave his daily war update from a new location deep within Gaza City’s Rantisi Children’s Hospital on Monday night.

title: Mali Leader Says Military Seized Control of Rebel Stronghold Kidal
description: BAMAKO, Mali (AP) — Mali's military has seized control of the northern town of Kidal, marking the first time the army has held the Tuareg rebel stronghold in nearly a decade, state broadcaster ORTM reported Tuesday.

title: UK Plans Incentives for Pension Funds to Build Affordable Homes
description: The UK government is developing plans to drive more pension fund money into affordable housing to address Britain’s homes shortage, Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt said.

title: Cameron's Baggage: New Foreign Secretary's Legacy of Brexit, China & Greensill
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Germany’s Habeck Signals Siemens Energy Has Deal in Loan-Guarantee Talks
description: Economy Minister Robert Habeck indicated Siemens Energy AG has reached an accord with the German government and other stakeholders, bringing to a close weeks of discussions over shoring up the company’s finances.

title: Russia’s Seaborne Crude Flows Edge Lower Before OPEC+ Meeting
description: Weekly shipments are back in line with Moscow’s pledged export cut

title: Trump Insists on ‘Disclaimer’ Defense Already Tossed in NY Fraud Trial
description: As he sat on the witness stand in a New York courtroom last week, Donald Trump reached into his pocket, pulled out a piece of paper and tried to hand it to the judge.

title: South Africa Names Acting Finance Chief With Godongwana on Leave
description: South Africa’s president appointed Kgosientsho Ramokgopa as acting finance minister, while Enoch Godongwana takes leave.

title: Moldova May Seek Initial EU Entry Without Breakaway Region
description: Moldova may seek to enter the European Union before it resolves the issue of its Russian-controlled breakaway region, President Maia Sandu said.

title: Putin and the West’s Test of Nerve in Ukraine
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: EU, US Scramble to Resolve JetBlue-Schiphol Spat
description: European Union officials will meet again with US counterparts in January as they work to resolve a dispute over JetBlue Airways Corp.’s expulsion from Amsterdam’s Schiphol airport.

title: Argentina’s Election Isn’t Just High Stakes for Argentina — But for China, Too
description: A Massa win would allow the Asian giant to maintain its foothold. A Milei victory, however, would likely slash China’s influence in the country

title: US Supreme Court’s Ethics Code Borrows From Other Judges — But Not Always
description: A new code of conduct announced by the US Supreme Court largely copies word-for-word ethics guidelines already in place for lower court judges.

title: Israel Gas Flows to Egypt Set to Return to Pre-War Level
description: Israel’s natural gas flows to Egypt may almost double to reach pre-war levels early next week, according to a person familiar with Egyptian imports, as safety concerns from the conflict with Hamas ease and a major gas field resumes output.

title: Musk, Citi’s Fraser Among the CEOs Wooing China’s Xi at APEC
description: Executives from Microsoft Corp., Citigroup Inc., Exxon Mobil Corp. and other large multinationals are converging on San Francisco this week for an audience with Chinese President Xi Jinping and other Asian leaders as long-frosty US-China relations show only tentative signs of warming.

title: Turkish Approval for Sweden’s NATO Bid Draws Closer
description: Turkey’s parliament is set to hold a debate this week over Sweden’s bid to join the NATO military alliance, as President Recep Tayyip Erdogan seeks to improve defense relations with US-led allies.

title: EU’s Ammunition Goal for Kyiv Never Realistic, Germany Says
description: German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius conceded that the European Union won’t meet a pledge to send Ukraine 1 million artillery shells by the end of March and questioned whether the goal the bloc set itself to help Kyiv beat back Russia’s invasion was always too ambitious.

title: EU Weighs Extending Steel-Trade Truce With US to Avoid Tariffs
description: The European Union is discussing the possibility of temporarily prolonging a truce with the US related to steel and aluminum trade, a prospect that would bypass stalled negotiations and avoid the return of tariffs on as much as $10 billion of transatlantic exports.

title: Nigeria Warns Labor Unions Against ‘Illegal, Immoral’ Strike
description: Nigeria’s government warned the country’s labor unions not to go ahead with a strike on Tuesday called in response to a police assault on one of their leaders.

title: Thailand Pitches $28 Billion Malacca Strait Bypass Project to US
description: Thailand is pitching a multibillion-dollar project that will significantly cut shipping times between the Indian and Pacific oceans by bypassing the Malacca Strait — one of the world’s busiest sea lanes.

title: Ethiopia Fails to Attract Any Bids for Third Telecom License
description: Ethiopia failed to attract any bids for a third wireless license, according to people with knowledge of the matter, amid concerns about conflict in parts of the Horn of Africa nation.

title: Thai PM Denies Chinese Police Patrol Plan After Public Outcry
description: Thailand’s Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin said there was no plan to invite Chinese police officers to patrol local tourist destinations, seeking to clear the air after comments by the country’s tourism authority about such a program created a furor.

title: Top Philippine Court Affirms Dismissal of Marcos Wealth Case
description: The Philippines’ Supreme Court has upheld a 2012 anti-graft court decision dismissing an ill-gotten wealth case against the family of President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.

title: Israel Latest: Gaza Hospitals in Focus as Biden Urges Restraint
description: The situation at two Gaza hospitals is under focus as Israel and Hamas trade accusations over the facilities and President Joe Biden called on Israel to take “less intrusive action” at the al Shifa hospital — the latest sign the US wants fewer civilian casualties.

title: Liberians Head Back to Polls to Choose Weah or Boakai as Leader
description: Liberians head back to the polls on Tuesday to choose either President George Weah or ex-vice president Joseph Boakai as their next leader.

title: Biden, Indonesia’s Widodo Affirm New Defense Cooperation Accord
description: The US and Indonesia announced a new defense cooperation agreement on Monday as Washington looks to counter Chinese influence across the Indo-Pacific with efforts to bolster defense and trade agreements.

title: US Grants Chinese Journalists Hundreds of Visas to Cover APEC
description: The US has given a large number of Chinese journalists permission to enter the country to cover the first meeting between presidents Xi Jinping and Joe Biden in a year, in a sign of improving ties.

title: GOP’s Johnson Turns to Democrats to Pass Plan to Avert Shutdown
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson is counting on Democrats to overcome misgivings and approve his proposal to avert a US government shutdown.

title: US, Asian Nations Not Ready to Finalize Economic Accord at APEC
description: The US and 13 Asian partner nations will fall short of announcing the completion of an economic accord at a regional summit in San Francisco led by President Joe Biden, as differences over trade linger after about a year of negotiations.

title: Taiwan Doubts China’s Xi Will Have the Ability to Invade by 2027
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping is unlikely to have the capability to conduct a successful invasion of Taiwan by 2027, according to a top Taiwanese security official, casting doubts on the progress of Beijing’s military modernization plans.

title: Biden, Xi to Announce Deal for China to Crack Down on Fentanyl
description: Joe Biden and his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, are set to announce an agreement that would see Beijing crack down on the manufacture and export of fentanyl, according to people familiar with the matter, potentially delivering the US president a major victory.

title: Venezuela’s Maduro Wants UN to Intervene in Dispute With Guyana
description: Venezuela wants United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres to intervene in its longstanding dispute with Guyana over a 61,600 square-mile territory known as the Essequibo, President Nicolás Maduro said Monday evening on his TV show.
